intro: Pedicularis × mathoneti, commonly known as the hybrid crowfoot orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often resembling the shape of a crow's foot. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral morphology, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of alpine flora.
